edu.mines.jtk.mesh
Class TriSurf

java.lang.Object
  edu.mines.jtk.mesh.TriSurf

public class TriSurf
extends java.lang.Object

A 3-D triangulated manifold oriented surface, possibly with boundary.

This class currently enables construction of a surface from a set of points, using the algorithm of Cohen-Steiner and Da, 2002, A greedy Delaunay based surface reconstruction algorithm: The Visual Computer, v. 20, p. 4-16.

Version:
2004.06.14, 2007.01.12
Author:
Dave Hale, Colorado School of Mines

          One triangular face in the surface.

          A type-safe iterator for faces.
static class TriSurf.FaceList
          A dynamically growing list of faces.
static class TriSurf.Node
          A node, which can be added or removed from the surface.
static interface TriSurf.NodeIterator
          A type-safe iterator for nodes.

Parameters:

Returns:
a face that references the specified node; or null, if the node is not in the surface or the surface has no faces.

findEdge

public TriSurf.Edge findEdge(TriSurf.Node nodeA,
                             TriSurf.Node nodeB)
Returns a directed edge AB that references the specified nodes.

Parameters:
nodeA - a node.
nodeB - a node.
Returns:
a directed edge that references the specified nodes; or null, if nodes A and B are not adjacent in the surface.
